page.title: 16BRITISH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY
page.content: Henry Thomas De La Beche founded the British Geological Survey in London in 1835,20 years before he died.The main function of the BGS is to map beneath the surface of the British Isles.The Keyworth branch opened in 1976 and has about 600 staff.They find out about the rock so that if someone wants to build a house etc. they can see if the rock is safe.The BGS also finds out what rock is under the North Sea off the coast of britain.The BGS has expanded over the years and now has 8 buildings (in Belfast, Lerwick,Leeds, Edinburgh, Exeter, Eskdalemuir, London and Keyworth).Apart from rocks the BGS holds records of all earthquakes.
